page.title: 07Religion in Colmonell
page.content: There is at present only one functioning church in Colmonell. The church is the Church of Scotland church at the west end of the village. There is a certain amount of confusion over the number of churches which have stood on the site of the present church but the most widely held belief is :Around 400 AD there was a Saint called Ninian who was the first missionary to come to Scotland. One of his followers was a man called Colmon and he built the first church on the site.At that time Colmonell was a Pictish settlement,the remains of which can still be seen behind Boghouse farm. A number of other churches followed on the same site until the present church which was built in 1772.
